alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:33AM CST until January 27 at 1:12PM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Blackwater River at Valley City affecting Johnson MO and Pettis Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Blackwater River near Blue Lick affecting Saline and Cooper Counties. Crooked River near Richmond affecting Ray County. Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County. For the Blackwater River...including Valley City, Blue Lick...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Crooked River...including Richmond...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wakenda Creek...including Carrollton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 16.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun 12pm 12pm 12pm Wakenda Creek Carrollton 16.0 15.7 Fri 8am 16.1 10.8 9.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.
